page.title: 16Social Clubs in Stevington
page.content: The majority of village meetings take place in the Village Hall next to the playing field.The Mother and Toddler Group provides an afternoon each week for children under three to play together.The Playgroup holds sessions three mornings a week. Eighteen seven to eleven year old girls belong to the Brownie Guide Pack which meets weekly. The weekly Youth Club provides a meeting place for teenagers where they can talk, play records and pursue indoor sports.The Women's Institute meets monthly for a talk on some practical,entertaining or topical subject.The Darby and Joan Club holds a meeting once a month for retired men and women to have tea, talk and play whist and dominoes. People also play pool,darts,cribbage and dominoes in the two public houses.
